arm_group.description: 13 canoeists from a training center (Cesson-Sévigné) of the French canoeing team
10 young recruits in military school of officers in ground forces of the French army (Saint-Cyr Coëtquidan)

brief_summary.textblock:
To attest if a cardiac fatigue appears (and to measure it if it does) during intense
      physical exercises in two groups of subjects:

        -  Canoeists from a training center (Cesson-Sévigné) of the French canoeing team during an
           intensive session of three weeks of endurance training;

        -  Young recruits in military school of officers in ground forces of the French army
           (Saint-Cyr Coëtquidan) during an intensive.

clinical_study.brief_title: FACEFI : Cardiac Fatigue During Intense Exercises - Pilot Study
clinical_study.condition: Cardiac Fatigue During Intense Physical Exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy men between 18 and 35 years old;

          -  Giving their writing informed consent;

          -  And affiliated to the French social security.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  To be a smoker.

          -  To present any known pathology that forbids the realisation of any test, or that can
             alter the measurements: cardiovascular risk factors treated or not (diabetes,
             dyslipidaemia, arterial hypertension, obesity), cardiac arrhythmia, coronary disease,
             heart failure, cardiac pacemaker or defibrillator, valvular disease after surgery or
             not, kidneys failure with dialyse or not, kidney pulmonary cardiac or liver
             transplantation, chronic bronchopneumopathy, asthma, etc.

          -  To take any medication that could alter autonomic nervous system or cardiovascular
             adaptation to maximal exercise (anti-arrhythmia, anti-hypertensive,
             anti-inflammatory,…).

          -  Drinking exciting drinks (coffee or tee for example) in the 12h before the tests.

          -  To be under legal protection (trusteeship, guardianship) or to be deprived of
             liberty.

intervention.description: Individual parameters of echocardiography and heart rate variability

clinical_study.official_title: FACEFI : Cardiac Fatigue During Intense Exercises - Pilot Study

oversight_info.authority: France: Agence Nationale de Sécurité du Médicament et des produits de santé

primary_outcome.description:
Speckle tracking will also be used to get strain parameters of the left ventricle. Measure will by recording daily before, during, and after a period of intensive training, in order to attest possible cardiovascular effects of such periods.
Echocardiographic data will be recorded at rest and during a submaximal exercise.
primary_outcome.measure: Measure of classical echocardiographic parameters to attest systolic and diastolic functions

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
Measure will by recording daily before, during, and after a period of intensive training, in order to attest possible cardiovascular effects of such periods.
Measure will be recorded during 5 min resting and 5 min standing.
secondary_outcome.measure: Measure of classical heart rate variability parameters

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label
